sentence.Network_en: Hemolytic icterus occurs in the neonate of the horse and swine.
sentence.Network_cn: 溶血性黄疸发生于马和猪的初生幼畜.

sentence.Network_en: The medicine was very effective in curing icterus.
sentence.Network_cn: 此药对于治理黄病有很好的疗效.

sentence.Network_en: The sclera of the eye is yellow because the patient has jaundice, or icterus.
sentence.Network_cn: 黄疸病人巩膜黄染.是由于胆色素在巩膜沉积所致.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: via Latin from Greek ikteros. The Latin term denoted jaundice, also a yellowish-green bird (the sight of which was thought to cure jaundice)

means.word_mean: 1. yellowing of the skin and the whites of the eyes caused by an accumulation of bile pigment (bilirubin) in the blood; can be a symptom of gallstones or liver infection or anemia
